title: template: iterate over map key+value pairs
body:
Neither Go's json template package not the json-template specification provides a
mechanism to 
access the key and value for iteration through a map. Ideally, I'd like to be able to
write 
something along the lines of (but not necessarily exactly like this):

{.repeated section MyMap}
   {.key}: {.value}
{.end}

where MyMap is a map, and {.key} and value {.value} provide access to the current key
and value.

It may not be necessary to provide the {.value} directive; in analogy with other
repeated sections, 
this should probably just be @. Thus {.key} plays the role of an index for non-map
iterations. 
Alternatively, @ could stand for an entire map entry, and field names 'key' and 'value'
could be 
used to get to these values. For instance: {@.key} instead of {.key}; analogous for the
values.
